content: What time is the ballot freeze?
Midnight-ish North American tomorrow for core content
I thought it was in about 40 minutes, are you telling me I have another 24 hours?
Grahame graciously extended it early this morning
I guess I will end up owing Grahame a beer
I'm not going to make it mysefl, and I'm not going to start post-freeze processing until about 7pm melbourne time Sunday evening
That is a very civilized time of day (for us :grin: )
we win 1 in 100 of the timezone things
Not sure its event that often.
ok. last call. Anyone still working?

Didn't do the Source / SourceElement change on OperationDefinition?
(just testing the code gen with the latest version)
And http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/device-status didn't end up in the Expansions.xml
device status is a post freeze thing. I'll make the sourceelement change now
Thanks, otherwise all good here.

ok, so further commits to the core that are substantive now require my permission. That is, any changes that:
- involves a SHOULD or a SHALL
- any addition of a new example
- any change to a coded concept or any bindings
- any changes to structures other than patterns
- any changes to page list
- adding new extensions or changing types

(note that this list is partly about substantive for the build tools)
@Brian Postlethwaite can you please review this list:
http://build.fhir.org/ballot-intro.html#patient
@Eric Haas @Rob Hausam please fill out this list: http://build.fhir.org/ballot-intro.html#observation
Looks ok to me. The most significant change is the terminology code-system change
That's the only substantiative change, right?
From the last ballot, yes.
thanks
@Eric Haas @Rob Hausam What's the deal with DeviceDefinition.partOf?
I have removed it - it looks like an error. I can't believe the tools didn't complain...

@Brian Postlethwaite http://build.fhir.org/cm-administrative-gender-v2.html still looks incorrect. The Other mappings for V2 is missing the mapping to other as well. The double listing of v2 and v3 mappings look to have been corrected though.
which exact mapping is missing

other (Other) :wider A (Ambiguous)
Is missing Other under the v2 column.
DSTU2: http://hl7.org/fhir/DSTU2/valueset-administrative-gender.html
Is it permissible during the ballot freeze to update the placement of classes in the UML diagram?
Grahame plans to spend a good bit of time doing exactly that. So long as you coordinate with him, I doubt he'd object to help...
yes you can improve the UML diagrams.note this:
https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/9-committers/subject/UML.20models
My intention (if allowed) was to update the UML hints on the resource spreadsheet but I understand that it is difficult to verify that I changed nothing else beyond these values other than my word.
I was hoping to work on the Contract UML diagram Monday evening (NA time)
you can work on the UML diagrams no problems. I was suggesting that you consider the inkscape route for your convenience
Is there a suggested approach to filling out the http://build.fhir.org/ballot-intro.html#observation list?

(1) you should first of review that the list of pages in the normative list is correct for Observation. if it's not, discuss with me

(2) for each page, review the delta, and make sure that for every substantive change since the last ballot, you know what task it came from

(3) for each task, make an entry in the list, with a short description of what changed, a link to the task, and links to the changed pages associated with the task. You can follow the template from infrastructure ballot notes

thanks - sounds like a bit of work to do
not sure what @Eric Haas's availability and plans are in the next few days, but will see about coordinating with him

Agree that DeviceDefinition.partOf isn't right - and it's still there. Are you going to remove it - or should we still fix it? DeviceDefinition is also not showing up in the Resource Index in the Categorized and Alphabetical tabs. @Eric Haas @Grahame Grieve
Did not know about the list thing. will look at it tomorrow. I have not been part of the whole DeviceDefinition thing. Jose has committed all that. So I am no help there.
I'll fix DeviceDefinition

It has been brought to my attention that SupplyRequest claims to be part of the Patient compartment, but doesn't list search parameters for Patient (or Practitioner or Device or RelatedPerson). Is that something we should fix now or later?
later
What about Observation being part of the Practitioner and RelatedPerson compartments, but not having search criteria for either?
I don't understand this - this is very thoroughly checked... at least I thought so
Perhaps I don't understand the rules for compartments. I thought you needed an explicit search criteria for each compartment something is part of.
indeed you do, and I increased the enforcement on this a couple of weeks ago
Observation has several search parameters for Practitioner and RelatedPerson but the parameters are not exclusive to just Practitioner or RelatedPerson is that the issue here?
GForge shows 2733 tasks applied to R4 since R3...
597 to apply... wooah

QA activities, normative page ValueSet - the first bit of text under the Normative candidate box looks like the editor assumed that the content here was markdown, but it hasn't been processed as such.
(The text just above 4.9.1 http://build.fhir.org/valueset.html#scope)

It displays

Value sets link between [[[CodeSystem]]] definitions and their use in [coded elements](terminologies.html).

Some of the datatypes introduced in the last few cycles for use with medication and device definitions have never appeared on the datatypes page.

The only reason for this was technical difficulties on my part in getting them to display.

I've now figured out how to get them to show (I think). Is this something that I can fix in the build this week?

It's purely a publishing visibility thing and wouldn't mean any changes to any models or examples.

People are always asking why the links don't go anywhere...
please describe what exact changes you have in mind

I am almost ready to check-in UML diagram corrections, I am waiting on the full build to complete. I just want to verify that it is OK to commit a change where the only items changed are the values in the UML column of the spreadsheet for the resource
yes
which resources are you doing?
Contract
ok thx
you didn't like the inkscape route?
It was easy enough to use the values in the UML column which I have done before rather than downloading, installing and re-learning inkscape (which I haven't used in years)
So a bunch of vs-cache files changed, should those get checked in? All I did was change the UML layout on one resource.
As well the vscache/null.cache was changed by the build, should this also be included in the check-in?
yes always check in the .cache files if svn says they've changed
Better to ask and verify rather than assume and break the rules
sure

Re datatypes:

There are 5 datatypes, that were added in December 2017

MarketingStatus
ProductShelfLife
ProdCharacteristic
SubstanceAmount
SubstanceMoiety

These are small structures that are common to several resources in the medication and substance definition and, as of recently, device definition space.

Currently it is not possible to view the UML or structure tree or attribute descriptions of any of these.

The resource links go to the datatypes.html page, but then there is nothing there.

I plan to add the "templates" to the build\source\datatypes.html page, so the UML diagrams will appear. (e.g. [%dt ProductShelfLife 12%] etc)

When I tried to get that in originally in 2017 I just couldn’t get it to work.

Now it seems easier, and I have a local build that shows the details (no "tabs" show, however but that's a detail for later).

In the future, these datatypes may very well be subject to change, renaming, deletion etc. but that is a different issue.

This is just about surfacing what is already there – mending the broken links essentially.

This will also mean adding a "one line" basic description that doesn’t exist now, because the template has a space for that
(although in theory that could be left blank, and it would be no worse than it is now).

If this is considered too much clutter on datatypes.html then these could also have their own pages, similar to dosage.html (if I could work out how to do that).
yes I don't want them in datatypes.html. given where we are, we go to ballot with things as that are, and we'll work on it after the ballot opens
ok will stand down then

@Andy Stechishin :

just want to verify that it is OK to commit a change where the only items changed are the values in the UML column of the spreadsheet for the resource

Please explain this:

pasted image
no. seems I should be asking svn to explain... sorry.

Ballot schedule....

  • the deadline for submitting content is end of day Aug 17
  • but i won't start processing till Sunday evening my time
  • the first thing I will process is the core build. And I need to get that one nailed immediately. So Sunday 7pm Australian eastern is a hard limit for changes to the core spec. it will go into full freeze at that time
  • I should have that uploading sometime on Monday, giving me the rest of the week to work on he IGs.
  • I have a hard deadline of noon Fri 24th Australian time. After that, I will be effectively gone for 48 hours or so.
  • IG editors, I will be working with you on quality issues through next week
For the rest of the world, Sunday evening Grahame's time is ~midnight pacific end of day Saturday, so you just got a day's grace.
Lloyd, we still need to edit ballot-intro.html
@Eric Haas @Rob Hausam what's the plan with regard to the substantive change list for observation
as far as I know, these are the only open issues
oh yes - and what did OO decide to do about Observation.context?
we approved the change to 'context'
I'm not sure what Eric is thinking regarding the open issues - I'll see about coordinating with him
the change to context is pre-applied, yes?
yes - I've already changed fhir-ips accordingly
I'm on it planning to generate it tonight. When I get back
The substantive change list
The context and extensions have been preapplied last week
ok thanks
@Grahame Grieve for observation we voted that the operations lastn and stats will be still be FMM5 so am going to remove from the normative page. OK?
ok but how did you propose to do that?
remove from this box:
Screen-Shot-2018-08-17-at-2.43.00-PM.png
.. which is auto-built. Removing it is more complicated than that
and change the status to stu
I'm removing it now
OK I was going to update the spreadsheet are you doing that?
OK TY
but do I edit the table on that page directly for changes?
or is is all autobuilt?
autobuilt
so what is the format for this list?
trying to create it now

you can follow the format above, but a table with 3 columns:

  • description
  • task references
  • page references
what I meant is text, excel or html or md?
html - see ballot-intro.html
OK and do I send it to you or commit it as a file
Screen-Shot-2018-08-17-at-2.55.59-PM.png
you can commit
OK great

getting close on the main ballot.. waiting for @Eric Haas's change notes for Observation, and have to update history. And any more QA from @Rick Geimer - then we're ready to go into the publication slide, I think
ah and one open discussion about narrative.
just committed the substantive list

are you doing that now?
I do have an additional update for the snomed page and extensible binding section
I'm not doing it now - close is still 30 hours away

that's what I thought - just sounded like you were saying something different!
I probably should get those done now and then come back to finishing up the IGs
@Eric Haas - looking at the list, you've done the differences between R3 and R4 ballot 2, not between R4 ballot 1 and R4 ballot 2, yes?
R3 and R4 ballot 2, not since the last ballot. Is that what you wanted?
I'm confused between R3 and now.
did you want since May?
OK I'll go ahead an parse out the new stuff sorry
well, let's not lose all the list - can you split it?
I assume we still need to officially submit by the content deadline? As in, an email to publishing with a link to the contents?
I will handle that
Well, I mean for IGs.
yes that. I will notify Lynn. Though it would be good for you to notify me formally by email that it's ready, and cc: Lynn
Okay, down to the last few errors on PDDI, will send when it's ready.
Thanks
yes I saved and committed only the new stuff

Al IG authors should review their change notes for updates of existing guides - I'll be paying careful attention to them. If you haven't written them in the IG itself, I will need them for the history. And review the description of the guide in the published history, and in http://www.fhir.org/guides/registry

if it's a new guide, check that that language in the IG proposal is still correct - I'll be using that for the history and the registry.

@Chris Moesel @Sarah Gaunt @Eric Haas @Lloyd McKenzie @Bryn Rhodes @Nagesh Bashyam @Rob Hausam @Stefan Karl
Do I need to do that - we are moving from for comment to stu...
yes you need to do that
Where do I put them?
And I have until tomorrow 7pm still right?
if you don't have a place, just send them to me by email.
yes. maybe a bit longer for history notes.
example:
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/2018Jan/changelog.html
another example:
Thanks
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/sdc/changes.html#v2.0
another example:
I was just going to ask about an example
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/qicore/history.html
so you can see we're flexible about style and location but there must be some
Ok - I can do something.. Will get it into my build so you don't have to worry about it.
one other thing: if any guides are based on 3.4.0, they're about to go to 3.5.0 when I start the upgrade slide. make sure I have the rights to commit to them
And I'm going to be finished before 7pm tomorrow...
CRD IG proposal updated so long description now reflects move to CDS Hooks.

History files and changes logs sitting in the pages directory for deqm, degm-r4, I looked over the deqm ig proposal and is still inline but the and I updated the proposal to reflect the FHIR versions we are using now.
ok thanks
All right, I'm done with the core publication. All I have to do now is the upgrade, and then the publication run
When does the version number change to 3.5? (the official build)

I'll be doing that at 7pm-ish tomorrow. First, a full build. Then change the version. Then run again, then upgrade the java code, then run again. Then upgrade the tx server. Then blow the tx cache and run again. Then upgrade the code again. Then run again. Then upgrade the tx server, then blow the tx cache and then.... run again.... ;-)

some day I'm going to have to figure out how to resolve all the circular dependencies (and in the meanwhile, hope that the intermediate hacked versions keep running so I can get through that sequence)
the really great thing is, I get to do all that again when we go to 3.6.0 on the trunk
The rewards ;)
@Grahame Grieve for the history page - for ECR what link should i be putting in for this ballot version - would it be: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/ecr/2018Sep/index.html?
yes that's correct

VhDir isn't currently listed in the IG registry, I think it should be, at least the CI Build.
(I guess I can make a pull request later)
go ahead and make a pull request then

@Grahame Grieve - we are pretty much good to go with ECR. One more question though - do I need to remove the box with the CI build stuff:

pasted image

Or will you take care of that?
I'll look after that
Thanks!
So for the eCR IG ballot I'm sending an email to you and Lynn - is that all I have to do?
sure
2 hours ;-)
ok freeze is on
ok. core is uploading to http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep. 39,135 files, 1.73GB
ok tag is made, core is uploading, freeze is off
The example json-edge-cases.json has invalid content in the core spec, shouldn't that be getting validated somewhere?
what's invalid?
The contained binary resource has a property called content, where it has been renamed to data in R4
(the .net serializer picked it up)

Also, heaps of examples don't roundtrip, search parameters don't all execute and invariant validations don't all work. Haven't chased them through to work out if its the .net fhirpath implementation and/or serilizer implementation yet.
hmm yes that json file is a special case.
can you make a task for me to validate that?
what doesn't round trip?
Sure.

Reviewing through changes, I've noticed that the ElementDefinition page only has an R2 diff tab, not an R3 diff tab. I thought that was generated?
http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep/elementdefinition.html
i've missed something - can you make a task?
Fortunately I think the correct content is available here http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep/diff.html
Sure.
none of them are correct
Bugger.
Tooling or infrastructure?
tooling
done GF#17721
see this note about the diffs: http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep/ballot-intro.html#round2

Bad news on those diff links too.
try clicking on the diff link between ballots for ElementDefinition, the base url is wrong.
http://hl7.org/fhir/2018May/elementdefinition.html
http://hl7.fhir.org/fhir/2018Sep/elementdefinition.html
@Grahame Grieve , that I mentioned here.

Grahame, unfortunately I only saw this just now. Following the cut-off, I shut down Zulip to reduce the noise. My commit, following your approval would have only been the single xml file for the spreadsheet. I manually add the files that I commit on the commandline and am exceptionally careful not to commit additional file. You can verifyu this with the SVN commit logs (look at the individual commits which will show you the files that were commited). I go to great lengths to ensure that I follow the committer rules (as was evidenced by my requesting permission to perform the commit in question)
this comment appears to several weeks old?

no. seems I should be asking svn to explain... sorry.

@Grahame Grieve sorry, I saw the first because it mentioned me but I just saw this as I was walking through all the old messages

glad it was not an issue
np

@Andy Stechishin To help with the noise issue, we've created #committers/announce which will be low-volume high-importance stuff. You're free to ignore this stream and #committers/notification when you're not actively committing but should monitor (or plan to catch up and read all entries in before resuming commits) committers/announce
I am subscribed to both, if I am not actively doing FHIR work then it does not make sense to have Zulip running. I have other feeds I need to follow and keep up-to-date on

That's fine. It's just that if you start committing again, you need to actually read all of the content in committers/announce. Whereas you can just mark committers and committers/notification as "all read" without looking at them.
